segments.en: Linked Discourses 15
2. The Second Chapter
20. Mount Vepulla

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
“Mendicants!”
“Venerable sir,” they replied.
The Buddha said this:
“Mendicants, transmigration has no known beginning.

segments.pli: Pubbā koṭi na paññāyati avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ.
segments.en: No first point is found of sentient beings roaming and transmigrating, hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving.

segments.pli: Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, imassa vepullassa pabbatassa ‘pācīnavaṃso’tveva samaññā udapādi.
segments.en: Once upon a time, mendicants, this Mount Vepulla was known as Pācīnavaṃsa.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena manussānaṃ ‘tivarā’tveva samaññā udapādi.
segments.en: And at that time people were known as Tivaras.

segments.pli: Tivarānaṃ, bhikkhave, manussānaṃ cattārīsa vassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṃ ahosi.
segments.en: The lifespan of the Tivaras was 40,000 years.

segments.pli: Tivarā, bhikkhave, manussā pācīnavaṃsaṃ pabbataṃ catūhena ārohanti, catūhena orohanti.
segments.en: It took them four days to climb Mount Vepulla, and four days to descend.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena kakusandho bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.
segments.en: At that time Kakusandha, the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha arose in the world.

segments.pli: Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa vidhurasañjīvaṃ nāma sāvakayugaṃ ahosi aggaṃ bhaddayugaṃ.
segments.en: Kakusandha had a fine pair of chief disciples named Vidhura and Sañjīva.

segments.pli: Passatha, bhikkhave, sā cevimassa pabbatassa samaññā antarahitā, te ca manussā kālaṅkatā, so ca bhagavā parinibbuto.
segments.en: See, mendicants! This mountain’s name has vanished, those people have passed away, and that Buddha has become fully extinguished.
So impermanent are conditions,
so unstable are conditions,
so unreliable are conditions.

segments.pli: Yāvañcidaṃ, bhikkhave, alameva sabbasaṅkhāresu nibbindituṃ, alaṃ virajjituṃ, alaṃ vimuccituṃ.
segments.en: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed regarding all conditions.

segments.pli: Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, imassa vepullassa pabbatassa ‘vaṅkako’tveva samaññā udapādi.
segments.en: Once upon a time this Mount Vepulla was known as Vaṅkaka.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena manussānaṃ ‘rohitassā’tveva samaññā udapādi.
segments.en: And at that time people were known as Rohitassas.

segments.pli: Rohitassānaṃ, bhikkhave, manussānaṃ tiṃsavassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṃ ahosi.
segments.en: The lifespan of the Rohitassas was 30,000 years.

segments.pli: Rohitassā, bhikkhave, manussā vaṅkakaṃ pabbataṃ tīhena ārohanti, tīhena orohanti.
segments.en: It took them three days to climb Mount Vepulla, and three days to descend.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena koṇāgamano bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.
segments.en: At that time Koṇāgamana, the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha arose in the world.

segments.pli: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bhiyyosuttaraṃ nāma sāvakayugaṃ ahosi aggaṃ bhaddayugaṃ.
segments.en: Koṇāgamana had a fine pair of chief disciples named Bhiyyosa and Uttara.

segments.pli: Passatha, bhikkhave, sā cevimassa pabbatassa samaññā antarahitā, te ca manussā kālaṅkatā, so ca bhagavā parinibbuto.
segments.en: See, mendicants! This mountain’s name has vanished, those people have passed away, and that Buddha has become fully extinguished.
So impermanent are conditions …

segments.pli: Bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, imassa vepullassa pabbatassa ‘supasso’tveva samaññā udapādi.
segments.en: Once upon a time this Mount Vepulla was known as Supassa.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena manussānaṃ ‘suppiyā’tveva samaññā udapādi.
segments.en: And at that time people were known as Suppiyas.

segments.pli: Suppiyānaṃ, bhikkhave, manussānaṃ vīsativassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṃ ahosi.
segments.en: The lifespan of the Suppiyas was 20,000 years.

segments.pli: Suppiyā, bhikkhave, manussā supassaṃ pabbataṃ dvīhena ārohanti, dvīhena orohanti.
segments.en: It took them two days to climb Mount Vepulla, and two days to descend.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena kassapo bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno hoti.
segments.en: At that time Kassapa, the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha arose in the world.

segments.pli: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tissabhāradvājaṃ nāma sāvakayugaṃ ahosi aggaṃ bhaddayugaṃ.
segments.en: Kassapa had a fine pair of chief disciples named Tissa and Bhāradvāja.

segments.pli: Passatha, bhikkhave, sā cevimassa pabbatassa samaññā antarahitā, te ca manussā kālaṅkatā, so ca bhagavā parinibbuto.
segments.en: See, mendicants! This mountain’s name has vanished, those people have passed away, and that Buddha has become fully extinguished.
So impermanent are conditions …

segments.pli: Etarahi kho pana, bhikkhave, imassa vepullassa pabbatassa ‘vepullo’tveva samaññā udapādi.
segments.en: These days this Mount Vepulla is known as Vepulla.

segments.pli: Etarahi kho pana, bhikkhave, imesaṃ manussānaṃ ‘māgadhakā’tveva samaññā udapādi.
segments.en: And these people are known as Magadhans.

segments.pli: Māgadhakānaṃ, bhikkhave, manussānaṃ appakaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ;
segments.en: The lifespan of the Magadhans is short, brief, and fleeting.

segments.pli: yo ciraṃ jīvati so vassasataṃ appaṃ vā bhiyyo.
segments.en: A long life is a hundred years or a little more.

segments.pli: Māgadhakā, bhikkhave, manussā vepullaṃ pabbataṃ muhuttena ārohanti muhuttena orohanti.
segments.en: It takes the Magadhans an hour to climb Mount Vepulla, and an hour to descend.

segments.pli: Etarahi kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno.
segments.en: And now I am the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha who has arisen in the world.

segments.pli: Mayhaṃ kho pana, bhikkhave, sāriputtamoggallānaṃ nāma sāvakayugaṃ aggaṃ bhaddayugaṃ.
segments.en: I have a fine pair of chief disciples named Sāriputta and Moggallāna.

segments.pli: Bhavissati, bhikkhave, so samayo yā ayañcevimassa pabbatassa samaññā antaradhāyissati, ime ca manussā kālaṃ karissanti, ahañca parinibbāyissāmi.
segments.en: There will come a time when this mountain’s name will disappear, those people will die, and I will be fully extinguished.
So impermanent are conditions,
so unstable are conditions,
so unreliable are conditions.

segments.pli: Yāvañcidaṃ, bhikkhave, alameva sabbasaṅkhāresu nibbindituṃ, alaṃ virajjituṃ, alaṃ vimuccitun”ti.
segments.en: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed regarding all conditions.”
That is what the Buddha said.

segments.pli: Idaṃ vatvāna sugato athāparaṃ etadavoca satthā:
segments.en: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
“For the Tivaras it was Pācīnavaṃsa,
for the Rohitassa, Vaṅkaka,
Supassa for the Suppiyas,
and Vepulla for the Magadhans.
Oh! Conditions are impermanent,
their nature is to rise and fall;
having arisen, they cease;
their stilling is true bliss.”
The Linked Discourses on the unknown beginning are complete.
